page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF WILLEY
page.content: The parish of Willey covers 759 acres, not all in the block. Although there is no Parish Council, a representive is appointed to Rugby Borough Council. There is at least one Parish meeting a year in the village hall. The village has no gas supply but is served by mains electricity.All houses have main drainage. A small digestive system sewage works is just outside the village.There is a Sub Post Office open mornings only & a postbox.The public telephone box is well used. A mobile library visits once a fortnight There is no shop but a baker calls. Farmhouse accommodation is found at Manor Farm,a new venture in 1985. The brewery owned pub,The Sarah Mansfield, named after a landlord's mother,serves bar food.The only public transport is a weekly minibus to Lutterworth market.
